intro: Grisebachianthus mayarensis, commonly known as the Mayarensis aster, is a flowering plant native to the Andean region of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of tubular and ray florets. The plant typically grows in high-altitude grasslands and rocky soils, exhibiting a compact growth habit. Its flowers are usually violet or purple in color, blooming during the cooler months of the year. Grisebachianthus mayarensis is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and potential ecological role in its native habitat.
